headers.name: Strict-Transport-Security
headers.invalid_explanation: [red]This header is malformed and does not specify a max-age property or the property is invalid. [normal]

explanation_patterns.present: [green]This header tells the user's browser that this site is only to be accessed using HTTPS during the next \1 seconds.

[red]This header specifies a max-age of 0 seconds. It is worse than not specifying the header, because it actively tells the user's browser to remove its cached HSTS Policy information for this website! [blue]It is recommended to set the max-age property to 31536000 seconds (1 year).
[yellow]This header tells the user's browser that this site is only to be accessed using HTTPS during the next \1 seconds. This is shorter than the recommended value of 31536000 seconds (1 year).

headers.name: X-Frame-Options
headers.absent_explanation: [red]The header is absent. [yellow]If a CSP frame-ancestors directive is used, this can be safely ignored.[normal]

explanation_patterns.present: [green]This header tells the user's browser to do no rendering within a frame.[normal]
[green]This header tells the user's browser to only render frames which have the same origin as the page itself.[normal]
[red]The use of the "ALLOW-FROM" directive is deprecated and no longer works in modern browsers.[normal]

headers.name: X-Content-Type-Options
headers.absent_or_invalid_explanation: [red]The header is either absent or malformed.[normal]

explanation_patterns.present: [green]The header is set to "nosniff".[normal]

headers.name: Content-Security-Policy
headers.absent_explanation: [red]No CSP is defined, and the header is absent.[normal]

explanation_patterns.present: [yellow]The header is present, but was not analysed. [normal]Please consider using [blue][underline]https://csp-evaluator.withgoogle.com/[normal] to assess the CSP header's value.
[green]This header forbids PDF readers from embedding the website's content inside PDF files.[normal]
[green]This header instructs PDF readers to apply the cross-domain policy served from this website's root.[normal]
[red]Any policy files served with Content-Type: text/x-cross-domain-policy are allowed, even if they are served by third-parties.[normal]
[red]Any policy files served by FTP whose file names are crossdomain.xml are allowed, even if they are served by third-parties.[normal]
[red]All policy files are allowed, even if they are served by third-parties.[normal]
[green]This header forbids the user's browser to send any Referer header along with requests.[normal]

This header forbids the user's browser to send a Referer header over insecure channels. [yellow]While this is not considered insecure, the full origin, path and querystring may be sent to third parties.[normal]
[red]The document's origin may transit over insecure channels.[normal]
[red]The full origin, path and querystring may transit over insecure channels.[normal]
[red]The full origin, path and querystring may transit over insecure channels.[normal]
[green]This header forbids the user's browser to send a Referer header over insecure channels, and instructs to only send the document's origin to secure channels[normal]
[green]This header instructs the user's browser to never send a Referer header over insecure channels, and to only send the document's origin to third parties.[normal]
[red]A full Referer header containing the full origin, path and querystring will be sent in every requests, including over insecure channels and to third parties.[normal]
[yellow]The header's value is an empty string.[normal]
